intro: Cryptantha divaricata, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss in dry climates. The species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
